thread.title: Northumberland tourism witnesses unprecedented growthTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Northumberland tourism witnesses unprecedented growthTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Northumberland tourism witnesses unprecedented growth
Bouncing back from the downturn, Northumberland’s tourism industry has exceeded its target to grow tourism by six per cent in three years, new figures have revealed.
Northumberland’s tourism industry is the county’s second largest employer.
The country received 9.3million visitors in 2014, a significant increase of 4.6 per cent from 8.8million in 2013 and the highest level since 2009.
The value of tourism to the local economy also increased by 8.4 per cent, from £706million in 2011 to £765.1mllion in 2014 which is well over the target of £749.2million.
This increase contributed an extra £17.4million to the country’s economy.
Attractions in the county reported an average 2.9 per cent increase in visitor numbers during 2014 compared to the previous year, with Tourist Information Centres also seeing an increase.
Visit Northumberland received the millionth visitor on Christmas Day in 2014 for the first time.
